author: fivedogit
content: Actually, one more question, <@403707149043105803> : you said "If we ban an opcode we have to bump the version number of EOF". Why would this be the case? Can't EOF be used, as-is, in whatever version it's in, to do other things? Why would the ban need to be part of the EOF spec itself?

author: _shemnon
content: We cannot change the spec so that a contract that was once valid becomes invalid under the same version.

author: _shemnon
content: We can go the other way, i.e. adding new opcodes which would have previously failed validation.

author: fivedogit
content: <@403707149043105803> (or anyone else), may I send you a Google doc link for this "ban ORIGIN" EIP to review?
